results.report_text:
MICU NSG PROG NOTE: DAYS
VS remain stable w/ ongoing concerns re: infection. Ribovirin therapy continues, tol fair.

ROS:

RESP: Post Ribo. tx this am felt " good" w/ persistent coughing. Congested. Clear upper , dim bases. Sats acceptable w/ 92% on RA, RR 28-30. Mid day noted to have increased sob w/ RR 40's, sats down to 90%. CXR had been done prior. Seen by team, felt to be atelectasis. Albuterol neb and incentive spirometry given.
4Lnc w/ sats 99% and resolution of SOB.

CARDIAC: hr wnl this am. After albuterol tx, pt up voiding. HR noted to abrubtly-> 146 st w/ occasional pvc. down to 104 after resting in bed. Team saw patient immediately after event. b/p 152/74 at time.
Felt to be albuterol related.

ID: temp low grade, 100po. Continues on Ribovirin per protocol, contact precautions for RSV, pt mask for pt's own safety during transfer between rooms.

RENAL: voiding

GI: takes po well

NEURO: intermittent anxiety, alert and oriented, cooperative.

LINES: functional periperal R arm.

HEME/ONC: He has close relationship w/ own hemeonc physician who will be here to see him this afternoon. Dr [**First Name (STitle) 289**] on service now covering for regular hemeonc.

SOCIAL: wife called, informed.

HEME: hct 25.8 ("i usually run in the 30's) but no evidence of active bleeding. For plt transfusion today.

Assess: low grade temp, increased resp distress.

PLAN: monitor. Team is discussing increasing fluid. Plt transfusion.
Sputum cultures. Contact precautions

Mr. [**Known patient lastname 11148**] is a 45 y.o. Male with h.o. CML s/p allogenic transplant,
   chronic GVH, bronchiolitis obliterans s/p recent transfer from the ICU
   for worsening dyspnea, AMS requiring intubation. Extubated and sent to
   7^th floor [**12-19**]
[**12-22**] ICU transfer for A. fib with RVR requiring dilt
   gtt.  Worsening respiratory status [**12-25**] requiring intubation
   Respiratory failure, chronic
   Assessment:
   Hypercarbic resp failure /aspiration pneumonia. Pt is s/ p trach
   placement.  Completed course for vap.  Vent settings changed to 50%
   cpap with 5 ppe and 10 ps with o2 sats > 95% and rr in the high teens
   to low 20
s. lungs clear on auscultation but diminished at the bases.
   pt remains off sedated bus continues to make his needs know by mouthing
   words or writing. Trach suctioned for mod amts of thick tan sputum.
   Action:
   Resp status monitored closely. Pulmonary toileting continues. Vap
   protocol monitored. Vent settings being weaned  as pt tolerates.
   Response:
   Tolerating  vent weaning and pt in no apparent resp distress.
   Plan:
   Continue to wean vent as pt tolerates. Continue with resp toileting.
   Pt to be screened for rehab
   Atrial flutter (Aflutter)
   Assessment:
   Received pt on diltiazem gtt at 15 mg/hr.  hr ranging form 80
s when
   medicated for pain control and in the 100-120
s when pt is awake
   ,anxious and in pain. Bp stable with sbp ranging from 90-120
   Action:
   Hemodynamics monitored closely.  Receiving lopressor 12.5 mg via ngt.
   Restarted on 90 mg po diltiazem q 6 hrs. diltiazem gtt d/c
d.  pt
   medicated x2 with fentanyl 50 mcg ivp x2. clonazepam dose increased to
   1 mg po qd.  Fentanyl patch increased to 75  mcg topically q 72 hrs.
   Response:
   1645 rhythmn converted to st with sbp of 111.
   Plan:
   Continue to follow hemodynamics.  Continue to medicate with lopressor
   and diltiazem as ordered.  Coninunte to medicate with fentanyl for pain
   control and offer pt lorazepam or haldol for increased level of anxiety
   though pt has been refusing to take these meds.
   Alteration in Nutrition
   Assessment:
   Pt  with [**Initials (NamePattern4) **] [**Last Name (NamePattern4) **] [**Hospital1 **] sump fdg tube in place receiving isosource tube
   fdgs . abd firm but nontender withpos bowel sounds on auscultation.
   Unable to place peg and dobhoff fdg tube.
   Action:
   Tube fdgs increased to 30cc
s/hr . dr [**Last Name (STitle) **] consulted for
   assessment of wether pt would tolerate surgical placement of peg.
   Response:
   Pt tolerating tube fdgs.
   Plan:
    Awaiting dr [**Last Name (STitle) **]
s exam and recommendations. Increase tube fdg as
   tolerated to a goal rate of 45cc
s/hr.
   Renal failure, acute (Acute renal failure, ARF)
   Assessment:
   Bu ultrasound pt does not have hydronephrosis but does have muddy cats
   evident on u&a. likely atn secondary to possible vancomycin toxicity
   and episodes of hypotension. With component of prerenal  from diuresis.
   Remains  oliguric and creat=2.2 hct this am down to 21.7. fluid balance
   pos 15.9 liters for los. Vancomycin level this am- 38.1
   Action:
   Fluid balance monitored closely.  Pt type and screened for transfusion
   of prbc
s and will be transfused with prbc
s. hd done at bedside.
   Monitor lytes as ordered.
   Response:
   Plan:
   Follow f luid balance and uo. Check Vanco trough level  2 hrs post
   completion of hd and again in the am.  Renal  team will determine next
   day of hd based  on Vanco level. Follow bun/creat.

results.report_text:
Mr. [**Known patient lastname 11148**] is a 45 y.o. Male with h.o. CML s/p allogenic transplant,
   chronic GVH, bronchiolitis obliterans s/p recent transfer from the ICU
   for worsening dyspnea, AMS requiring intubation. Extubated and sent to
   7^th floor [**12-19**]
[**12-22**] ICU transfer for A. fib with RVR requiring dilt
   gtt.  Worsening respiratory status [**12-25**] requiring intubation.
   Atrial flutter (Aflutter)
   Assessment:
   Remains in aflutter  no observed ectopy rate 80-90
   Bp  90 to 110 systolic with MAP above 60.
   Action:
   Diltiazem 60 mgs q6 as ordered. .
   Response:
   Hr appears to be well controlled with po dilt.
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor HR/bp
   Adjust dilt dose as needed.
   Respiratory failure, chronic
   Assessment:
   Pt. remains nasally intubated on vent: CPAP 40%/[**11-6**]. Pt. failed SBT
   yesterday as he became tachypneic and agitated. Also noted to desat
   during SBT. Pt. back on lasix gtt at 15mc/hr with goal fluid balance
   -1-2L. Breath sounds CTA. Diminished in bases.  Pt. on fent/versed gtt
   for comfort. Awake and alert on current doses, however, pain free.
   Action:
   Lasix gtt maintained at 15mg/hr with good UO. Pt. turned Q2h, mouth
   care Q4h. Suctioned PRN. SBT/RSBI done this am.
   Response:
   Pt. remains stable at this time on current vent settings Fluid balance
   -244 at 0500 on max dose of lasix gtt. Cr 2.0 RSBI 137.
   Plan:
   Monitor resp status closely. Family meeting needs to occur to establish
   plan of care. ? trach vs. extubation. At this time pt. remains a full
   code.
   Anemia, other
   Assessment:
   Pt.
s Hct 21 [**12-31**] evening. Pt. ordered for a unit of blood, however,
   refused blood stating that he was
feeling fine
. Oncology and MICU MDs
   respected pt.
s wishes and blood not administered at that time. No S/S
   bleeding. No c/o dizziness and hemodynamically stable.
   Action:
   Hct rechecked with am labs 20. Type and cross sent to lab.
   Response:
   Pt. continues to refuse blood products at this time.
   Plan:
   MDs to speak with Mr. [**Known patient lastname 11148**] regarding importance of blood
   transfusion. If pt. agrees he will receive 1U PRBCs.
   ------ Protected Section ------
   AM K+ and phos repleted. See 1 time dosing sheet. Lasix gtt off at 0600
   ------ Protected Section Addendum Entered By:[**Name (NI) 498**] [**Last Name (NamePattern1) 729**], RN
   on:[**3104-1-1**] 05:44 ------

results.report_text:
Mr. [**Known patient lastname 11148**] is a 45 y.o. Male with h.o. CML s/p allogenic transplant,
   chronic GVH, bronchiolitis obliterans s/p recent transfer from the ICU
   for worsening dyspnea, AMS requiring intubation. Extubated and sent to
   7^th floor [**12-19**]
[**12-22**] ICU transfer for A. fib with RVR requiring dilt
   gtt.  Worsening respiratory status [**12-25**] requiring intubation.
   Atrial flutter (Aflutter)
   Assessment:
   Pt remains in atrial flutter with rate between 90-110, goes up to 130
   when stimulated for care.
   Action:
   Continues on diltiazem 60 mgs q6 as ordered. .
   Response:
   HR well controlled with po dilt.
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor HR/ BP
   Adjust diltiazem  dose as needed.
   Respiratory failure, chronic
   Assessment:
   Received pt nasally intubated  and vented with foll settings : CPAP
   40%/[**4-6**]. Suctioned for copious amounts of thick, yellow secretions.
   Oral secretions also remains very thick and yellow.  Afebrile, Spo2
   above 95%.
   U/O just around 20-30cc/hr this shift.   BUN /creat trending up 39/2.2
   this a.m. Team aware.
   A.M RSBI  was 119.
   Action:
   Remains intubated. Plan of care to be finalized. Continues  on sedation
   with fentanyl 75mcg/hr and versed 1mg/hr.
   1L NS bolus given for U/O without effect.
   Response:
   On going. U/O  20
30cc/hr after fluid bolus. Team aware.
   Plan:
   Monitor resp status closely. Family meeting needs to occur to establish
   plan of care. ? trach vs. extubation. At this time pt. remains a full
   code.  Keep comfortable with fent/versed gtts.
   Anemia, other
   Assessment:
   Pt.
s Hct 20.5 yesterday a.m.   Pt. was  ordered for a unit of blood,
   however, refused blood stating that he was
feeling fine
. Oncology and
   MICU MDs respected pt.
s wishes and blood not administered.
   No visible signs of bleed. Hemodynamically stable.
   Unable to draw labs from double lumen midline since yesterday ,
   altepase was placed for catheter clearance , with  effect.
   Able to draw labs   from KVO port.  Good return flow .  HCT 22.0 this
   a.m.
   Action:
   Labs drawn this a.m. HCT 22.0
   Response:
   Pt. continues to refuse blood products at this time.
   Plan:
   MDs to speak with  pt regarding importance of blood transfusion. If pt.
   agrees he will receive 1U PRBCs. At this time he has not received any
   blood products  since the HCT of 20.5.
   Tube feeds at goal at 45cc/hr.  Abdomen soft with + BS.  No BM this
   shift.

result_display.result_content: MDs to speak with pt regarding importance of blood transfusion.
result_display.sentence: MDs to speak with pt regarding importance of blood transfusion.

   discussion between IP, heme/onc, radiology, surgery regarding MRA vs
   CTA (given his renal failure).  Ultimately, he needed stat CTA neck.
   Discussed this with patient and his wife to great depths.  He was

   45 y.o. Male with h.o. CML s/p allogenic transplant, chronic GVH,

   -- Continue trials of decreased pressure support

   -- IP consult to tap pleural effusions which will hopefully make pt
   less ventilator dependent
 ANXIETY: Likely superficial bleeding given quick control with local
   epi. CT neck on my read negative. Low concern for arterial erosion into
   airway.
   -Monitor wound site closely for signs of bleeding.
   -F/u CTA Neck final read
 OLIGURIC RENAL FAILURE, ACUTE (ACUTE RENAL FAILURE, ARF): Secondary
   to ATN (hypotension and supratherapeutic vanc levels) with low urine
   output. Vanc levels trending down. Pt likely will have needed HD
   permanently, therefore CTA unlikely to be harmful.

   -- Monitor daily vanc levels

s, Cr

   -- Trend hct

 .H/O CANCER (MALIGNANT NEOPLASM), OTHER: Complicated by chronic GVHD

   MICU ATTENDING ADDENDUM
   I saw and examined the patient, and was physically present with the ICU
   team for the key portions of the services provided. I agree with the
   note above, including the assessment and plan. I would emphasize and
   add the following points: 45M CML s/p BMT c/b BO / GVHD p/w resp
   failure. IR PEG placed, CT s e/o tracheo-inominate fistula.
   Exam notable for Tm 99.8 BP 110/59 HR 90/AFL RR 18 with sat 100 on VAC
   450x16 5 0.5. Frail man, lucid, follows commands. No new bleeding at
   trach site. Coarse BS. Hyperdynamic s1s2. Soft +BS. Diffuse skin
   changes c/w GVHD. Labs notable for WBC 11K, HCT 22, K 4.3, Cr 3.2.
   Agree with plan to manage multifactorial respiratory failure with vent
   support and PSV wean; continue azithro and pred for BO, HD for volume
   removal and IP consult for R thoracentesis to assist in weaning. Will
   consider TM trials after procedures. Trach bleed stable, will confirm
   no TIF on final CT read. ARF continues with minimal UOP, tolerating HD,
   would favor aggressive volume removal to assist in weaning. Atrial
   flutter
 dilt / metoprolol per NGT. Keppra for TL mass / possible
   seizures - give after HD. Will d/w BMT re acyclovir and bactrim
   prophylaxis, continue fluconazole. Resume TFs today, monitor FSG. PT /
   OT eval, rehab screening. Fentanyl patch / klonopin for anxiety
   working well. Remainder of plan as outlined above.
   Total time: 35 min
